author: @infoitinterno
title: Giovanni Toti accusato di corruzione per una cena elettorale
text: [ ](/a/C00313E6-06B1-4E55-9FAE-1C3D29D489F2/Giovanni-Toti-accusato-di-corruzione-per-una-cena-elettorale-si-apre-un-nuovo-filone-d-indagine) [Leggi](https://notizie.virgilio.it/giovanni-toti-accusato-di-corruzione-per-una-cena-elettorale-si-apre-un-nuovo-filone-d-indagine-1633358) L'ex presidente della Regione Liguria, Giovanni Toti, è stato nuovamente accusato di corruzione in relazione a una cena elettorale organizzata il 14 aprile 2024 a Villa Lo Zerbino, a Genova. L'evento, volto a raccogliere fondi in vista delle elezioni regionali del 2025, è al centro delle indagini della Procura. Secondo le accuse, Toti avrebbe stretto un accordo con l'imprenditore portuale Aldo Spinelli per organizzare la cena elettorale. L'evento ha visto la partecipazione di oltre 600 invitati, con una quota di partecipazione non inferiore a 450 euro a persona. Le nuove accuse di corruzione sono emerse dagli atti depositati dai pubblici ministeri Federico Manotti e Luca Monteverde. L'iscrizione nel registro degli indagati è avvenuta il 24 aprile 2024, in preparazione del processo fissato per il 5 novembre. Il quadro accusatorio potrebbe consolidarsi ulteriormente con l'avvicinarsi del processo. Le nuove ipotesi di reato sono state formulate in vista della prima udienza, prevista per il 5 novembre, del processo con giudizio immediato. La vicenda rappresenta un ulteriore guaio per Giovanni Toti e Aldo Spinelli, già al centro di altre indagini per corruzione. La cena elettorale del 14 aprile 2024 potrebbe rivelarsi un elemento cruciale nel processo che si terrà a novembre.

author: Medscape UK
title: Grippe aviaire : un premier cas humain grave aux Etats-Unis
text:
Nouvelle-Orleans – Pour la première fois depuis le début de l’épidémie américaine, un cas grave de grippe aviaire a été recensé chez un homme. La Californie a décrété l’état d’urgence.
Jour après jour, l’inquiétude monde sur la situation sanitaire aux Etats-Unis et la menace que fait peser sur la santé publique mondiale l’épidémie de grippe aviaire H5N1 en cours dans le pays. Neuf mois après le début de l’épidémie dans les élevages de vaches laitières et la survenue du premier cas humain, ce sont au total 61 cas chez l’homme qui ont été recensés dans le pays.
Jusqu’alors, l’intégralité des sujets atteints avaient présenté des symptômes bénins, notamment une conjonctivite. Mais ce mercredi, les autorités de l’Etat de Louisiane ont pour la première fois fait état d’un cas grave de contamination par le virus H5N1. Il s’agit d’un homme de 65 ans, souffrant de maladies chroniques. Il a été hospitalisé « dans un état critique » et souffre d’une « sévère affection respiratoire » ont précisé les autorités de Louisiane. Rappelons que sur les près de 1 000 cas humains recensés dans le monde ces 25 dernières années avant l’épidémie américaine, environ la moitié ont conduit à la mort du patient.
La Californie décrète l’état d’urgence
Le patient de Louisiane a vraisemblablement été contaminé au contact d’oiseaux infectés. Un séquençage génétique a permis d’établir que le virus qui l’a contaminé était différent de celui qui circule dans les élevages de vaches laitières et est plus proche d’un virus détecté chez des oiseaux dans l’Etat de Washington aux Etats-Unis et la province de Colombie-Britannique au Canada. Le mois dernier, les autorités de cette province canadienne ont également fait état d’un cas grave de grippe aviaire chez un adolescent.
Selon le Centre de contrôle et de prévention des maladies (CDC), ce cas grave « ne change pas l’évaluation par le CDC du risque immédiat causé par la grippe aviaire pour la santé humaine, qui reste faible ». Quelques heures après l’annonce de ce premier cas sévère, l’Etat de Californie a cependant décidé de déclencher l’état d’urgence sanitaire.
Avec 34 hommes atteints et des centaines d’élevages de vaches touchés, le « Golden State » est l’Etat le plus touché par l’épidémie pour le moment.« Bien que le risque pour le public reste faible, nous continuerons à prendre toutes les mesures nécessaires pour prévenir la propagation » a expliqué le gouverneur de Californie Gavin Newsom pour justifier sa décision.
L’état d’urgence permettra notamment de donner plus de pouvoirs aux autorités sanitaires et de renforcer la politique de dépistage. « En nous appuyant sur le système de dépistage et de surveillance de la Californie, nous nous engageons à protéger davantage la santé publique, à soutenir notre industrie agricole et à fournir aux Californiens des informations exactes et actualisées » a poursuivit le gouverneur.
Kennedy contre Pasteur
La principale crainte des autorités sanitaires est bien sûr que le virus H5N1 ne mute et ne devienne transmissible entre humains, déclenchant une véritable épidémie. « Aucun cas de transmission interhumaine n’a été pour le moment détecté » a rappelé le CDC dans un communiqué ce mercredi. Cependant, dans deux observations américaines et dans le cas canadien, la source de l’infection n’a pas pu être déterminée.
Il a déjà été établi que le virus avait muté pour devenir plus transmissible entre mammifères, expliquant comment une épidémie avait pu débuter chez les vaches, animal qui n’avait jamais été contaminé par la grippe aviaire avant cette année. Selon une étude parue dans la revue Science le 5 décembre dernier, il suffirait d’une seule mutation pour que le virus devienne transmissible entre hommes, mais il est difficile d’établir la probabilité que cette mutation survienne.
L’autre crainte des scientifiques est la naissance, via un animal intermédiaire, d’un virus recombinant mélangeant le virus de la grippe aviaire et celui de la grippe saisonnière. La contamination d’un porc aux Etats-Unis le mois dernier a fait ressurgir cette crainte.
Quelque soit le risque réel causé par cette épizootie, beaucoup de scientifiques regrettent que les autorités fédérales aient pris cette crise sanitaire à la légère. La gestion de la situation a été quasiment intégralement relégué aux Etats et aucune obligation de dépistage n’a été imposé aux éleveurs. L’intérêt de l’industrie agro-alimentaire a été priorisé au détriment de la santé publique, avec un conflit d’intérêt évident, l’actuel ministre de l’Agriculture Tom Vilsack étant un ancien lobbyiste laitier.
L’arrivée au pouvoir de Donald Trump le 20 janvier prochain ne devrait pas arranger la situation : son futur ministre de la Santé, Robert Kennedy Jr, est un partisan de la consommation de lait cru, alors même que la pasteurisation permet de tuer le virus dans le lait.

author: CARSON HUGHES
title: The Great Le Sueur Treasure Hunt Clue No. 2 - NewsBreak
text: The Great Le Sueur Treasure Hunt is on. Three medallions have been hidden across the city of Le Sueur. The expert-level medallion has already been found, but the intermediate and beginner level medallions remain undiscovered. Kim, August, Sarah and Lydia found the expert medallion after just one clue was released. Based on the clue "Find the edge," the family discovered the medallion near the welcome sign at the south end of town. Until the remaining two medallions are found, each week, Le Sueur County News and the Henderson Independent will be publishing and broadcasting clues to help steer treasure hunters in the right direction. Le Sueur County News will be posting clues to our Facebook page every Monday as a new clue for the intermediate-level medallion drops. Clue No. 2 Two seals will show you the way. Clue No. 1 Grease is #1.

author: 张苇柠
title: 湖南省益阳市 "益薪无忧"解除劳动者忧"酬" - 权益 - 中工网
text:
湖南日报8月6日讯（全媒体记者 雷鸿涛 通讯员 田毅诚 胡竞平）曾在湖南省益阳市某工程项目粉刷外墙的农民工欧某良等5人，在完工后被拖欠工资26.54万元。前不久，工友将欠薪情况反映到职能部门。“所有工资一分不少拿到了手，我们都很满意。”近日，欧某良对回访的益阳市人力资源和社会保障局工作人员说。
益阳人社部门打造“益薪无忧”名片，形成“预防—治理—惩戒”全链条治理欠薪机制，全市根治欠薪工作连续5年被省政府评为A级。今年以来，该市已为1954余名劳动者追索欠薪1452.52万元。
“益薪无忧”，预防为先。该市梳理形成22项整治欠薪部门责任清单，33项建设单位和施工单位责任清单。在工程项目建设领域，全面推行农民工实名制、工资专用账户制、总包代发制、工资保证金制、维权信息公示制、工程款支付担保制和应急周转金“6制1金”管理。创新施行“三员监管”，对全市146个在建工程项目均配备劳动监察员、行业监督员、劳资专员。如今，项目用工行为更加规范，劳动合同签订率、工资专用账户开户率均达100%。
“我们对欠薪问题线索，实行‘交办—执行—反馈—销号’闭环管理。”益阳市人社局局长肖凤南介绍，益阳探索跨部门联动、跨区域协同治理欠薪难题，全市一体联动，有效破解“异地维权难”问题。该市常态化开展“利剑护蕾·整治欠薪”等专项行动，去年冬季行动中，市领导约谈17个欠薪重点项目负责人，整改问题31个，工资清偿1000余万元。
对涉嫌拒不支付劳动报酬罪的案件，该市公安机关提前介入，行政执法与刑事司法紧密衔接。同时，将欠薪企业纳入失信联合惩戒名单，限制其招投标、融资、高消费等行为，形成“一处失信、处处受限”的格局。

author: PA News Agency
title: Woman believed to be held hostage in Gaza declared dead | East London and West Essex Guardian Series
text: A hard-hit Israeli kibbutz has announced the death of Judih Weinstein — an American-Canadian-Israeli woman who had been thought to be held hostage in Gaza. The news came six days after Ms Weinstein’s husband, Gad Haggai, was also declared dead. Ms Weinstein, 70, and Mr Haggai, 73, were taking an early morning walk near their home in Kibbutz Nir Oz on the morning of October 7 when Hamas militants burst across the border into Israel, killing about 1,200 people and kidnapping 240 others. In the early hours of the morning, Ms Weinstein was able to call emergency services and let them know that both she and her husband had been shot and send a message to her family. Ms Weinstein and her husband had been thought to be among the hostages still held in captivity in Gaza. But six days ago, the kibbutz announced that Mr Haggai was killed on October 7 and his body was taken to Gaza. On Thursday, the kibbutz said it had learned that Ms Weinstein was also killed on October 7 and her body is also being held in Gaza. It was not immediately clear how Israeli authorities determined their deaths. The couple are survived by two sons and two daughters and seven grandchildren, the kibbutz said. US President Joe Biden said he was “devastated” to learn of Ms Weinstein’s death, especially after hearing about the couple during a meeting with their daughter. The families “have been living through hell for weeks. No family should have to endure such an ordeal”, he said in a statement. Ms Weinstein was born in New York and was an active member of Kibbutz Nir Oz, a small community near the Gaza border where she taught English to children with special needs. The kibbutz said she also taught meditation techniques to children and teenagers who suffered from anxiety as a result of rocket fire from Gaza. Mr Haggai was a retired chef and jazz musician. “Judy dedicated her life to serving others, spending years teaching English and using her passions for poetry, puppeteering, and mindfulness to empower children of all backgrounds,” her family said in a statement. In a YouTube video made during a brief round of fighting between Israel and the Islamic Jihad militant group last May, Ms Weinstein read a series of poems and expressed hope for better days ahead. “I truly hope that the next time I’m recording some Haiku it won’t be under duress, under rocket fire, under conditions where people are at war,” she said. “May we all be granted the right to our basic rights of home, food, shelter and peaceful days. Here’s hoping.” Al Haggai, one of the couple’s sons, told Israel’s Channel 13 that the family had originally hoped their mother’s multiple citizenships would allow her to be released during the week-long ceasefire in late November, when 105 hostages were let go. Almost all were women and children. He said that when his mother’s name was not on any of the daily lists, he started to suspect that something had happened to her. According to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office, at least 23 of the approximately 129 hostages believed to be held in Gaza have either died or been killed in captivity. Nir Oz was one of the hardest-hit Israeli communities on October 7, with roughly a quarter of its residents killed or kidnapped. The families of missing hostages have drawn widespread support and sympathy in Israel as they press the government to reach a new ceasefire deal to bring home their loved ones. Mr Netanyahu met on Thursday in Tel Aviv with some of the families, where he told them there were behind-the-scene efforts to bring the hostages home, according to a statement from his office. “I can’t elaborate on the details, we are working to return everyone,” he said. author: epa.gov
title: Biden-Harris Administration announces the University of Mississippi as the recipient of $749,476 to support Clean U.S. Manufacturing of Construction Materials | US EPA
text:
July 17, 2024 Contact Information EPA Region 4 Press Office ( ) (404) 562-8400 JACKSON, Miss. (July 17, 2024) - T he U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced the University of Mississippi as the recipient of approximately $749,476 in grant funding to support efforts to report and reduce climate pollution from the manufacturing of construction materials. EPA estimates that the construction materials used in buildings and other built infrastructure account for more than 15% of annual global greenhouse gas emissions.
Billions of tons of concrete, asphalt, steel, glass and other construction materials and products are required to build, maintain and operate our country’s buildings and infrastructure. The U.S. leads the world in the production of clean construction materials, and these transformative awards from President Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act—the largest climate investment in history--will reduce climate pollution by helping businesses measure the carbon emissions associated with extracting, transporting and manufacturing their products.
The grants will support the Biden-Harris Administration’s Federal Buy Clean Initiative , which leverages the U.S. government’s sway as the largest purchaser on Earth to catalyze demand for clean construction materials used in federal buildings, highways, and infrastructure projects. The grants will be awarded to businesses, universities and nonprofit organizations serving all 50 states and will help disclose the environmental impacts associated with manufacturing concrete, asphalt, glass, steel, wood and other materials.
The University of Mississippi’s project will focus on investigating the potential reduction of embodied greenhouse gas emissions by implementing warm mix asphalt (WMA) technologies that integrate reclaimed asphalt pavement. To achieve this goal, the University of Mississippi will assess the effects of WMA technologies on greenhouse gas emissions through life cycle assessment and life cycle impact assessment. Additionally, the research will entail an evaluation of the mechanical properties and durability characteristics of asphalt mixtures through a comprehensive experimental program. This approach will enable the development of balanced mix design criteria using three-dimensional performance interaction diagrams.
The research will incorporate a multi-objective optimization technique and machine learning techniques to optimize the design of asphalt mixtures while considering cost, carbon dioxide emissions and energy consumption.
The University of Mississippi will collaborate with various stakeholders to advance this project, including state transportation agencies, technical assistance providers, private businesses, local communities, trade associations and nonprofit organizations. This collaborative effort will ensure that the project's findings and innovations can be widely adopted and implemented. By integrating environmental and mechanical evaluations with advanced optimization techniques, this research willl identify sustainable, durable and cost-effective asphalt mixtures to help reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
“As America continues to build more and upgrade our nation’s infrastructure under President Biden’s leadership, cleaner construction materials like concrete and steel are increasingly essential for the nation’s prosperity,” said EPA Deputy Administrator Janet McCabe. “These historic investments will expand market access for a new generation of more climate-friendly construction materials, and further grow American jobs that are paving the way to the clean energy economy.”
The grants will help businesses develop robust, high-quality environmental product declarations (EPDs), which show environmental impacts across the life of a product and can catalyze more sustainable purchasing decisions by allowing buyers to compare. Investments in data and tools will make high-quality EPDs available for 14 material categories, which include both new and salvaged or reused materials. These efforts will help standardize and expand the market for construction products with lower greenhouse gas emissions. They will make it easier for federal, state and local governments and other institutional buyers to ensure the construction projects they fund use more climate-friendly products and materials.
EPA is also announcing expanded technical assistance opportunities to businesses, the federal government and other organizations across America. EPA will initially offer EPD development support and direct businesses to resources to help them measure and reduce the embodied carbon associated with their materials, such as those provided by the ENERGY STAR Industrial program. Federal agencies and their suppliers will be able to compare the climate impact of various materials to drive near-term greenhouse gas emissions reductions. Robust EPD data will be further strengthened by a new label program under development that will identify low carbon construction materials for the growing Buy Clean marketplace.
Together, the grants and technical assistance programs will reduce greenhouse gas emissions and support American jobs. These programs are made possible by the Biden Administration’s Inflation Reduction Act of 2022, which creates significant investments aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions associated with the extraction, transport and manufacturing of construction materials and products. The Inflation Reduction Act also provides more than $2 billion to the General Services Administration to use low embodied carbon materials in the construction and renovation of federal buildings and $2 billion to the Federal Highway Administration to incentivize or reimburse the use of low embodied carbon construction materials in certain transportation projects.
Selections are contingent upon completion of legal and administrative requirements and grantees are tentatively expected to receive their funding in late summer.
Learn more about EPA’s Grant Program for Reducing Embodied Greenhouse Gases in Construction Materials and Products.

author: Raúl Pozo
title: Sandra Ortega dopa a su inmobiliaria tras recoger los frutos de un año histórico en Inditex
text:
Noticias relacionadas Inditex gana un 32,5% más y mantiene un incremento de ventas a doble dígito La apuesta de Inditex por EEUU mantiene a la compañía en máximos Sandra Ortega ganó un 17% menos en 2022 por la caída bursátil de Inditex Sandra Ortega desahucia a Room Mate de dos hoteles de Nueva York y Miami El año descollante en bolsa que Inditex está a punto de cerrar ha tenido su correspondiente efecto en los principales accionistas de la compañía. Ha sido el caso de Sandra Ortega , la mujer más rica de España gracias a la participación del 5% que mantiene en el imperio textil fundado por su padre, Amancio Ortega . En un 2023 que Inditex concluirá en máximos históricos, la primogénita del dueño de Zara ha aprovechado para inyectar más capital en sus negocios inmobiliarios con el fin de abrir camino a nuevas inversiones.
De esta forma, Sandra Ortega ha procedido a ejecutar una ampliación de capital en Ferrado Inmuebles , la sociedad a través de la que canaliza su apuesta por el sector inmobiliario, al que destina, al modo de cómo lo hace su padre, parte de los dividendos que percibe de la compañía cotizada.
25 millones más En concreto, el capital de Ferrado ha quedado fijado en 130 millones de euros tras la reciente inyección de 25 millones de euros realizada por la inversora. Sólo en el actual ejercicio, Sandra Ortega ha ingresado en torno a 185 millones de euros en concepto de retribución al accionista de la empresa que ahora preside su hermanastra, Marta Ortega .
La operación supone elevar cerca de un 25% la anterior cifra de capital de Ferrado, que cuenta con una cartera de inmuebles en renta, situados en el extranjero, principalmente en EEUU .
Valor estrella en 2023 Con una revalorización próxima al 60% desde enero, Inditex ha sido uno de los valores estrella del ejercicio en el parquet, lo que ha elevado el valor del patrimonio de Sandra Ortega hasta cotas inéditas.
De acuerdo con la relación de grandes fortunas mundiales que elabora y actualiza periódicamente la agencia Bloomberg , el patrimonio de la inversora se sitúa en estos días por encima de los 9.100 millones de dólares (cerca de 8.200 millones de euros al cambio actual).
Una tienda de Zara en Barcelona EP
A los precios a los que cotizan las acciones de Inditex, la participación de Sandra Ortega esta valorada en cerca de 6.250 millones de euros. La diferencia se corresponde con su cartera inmobiliaria , a la que prepara para ser ampliada gracias a la buena marcha de Inditex en el mercado.
En el caso de su progenitor, el ejercicio que está a punto de terminar ha sido especialmente intenso en cuanto a la actividad inversora se refiere. El empresario ha adquirido numerosos activos relacionados con el sector logístico , especialmente en EEUU, e inmuebles en diversos mercados, entre los que se incluye el muy cotizado de Londres.
Diversificación Pero además, el hombre más rico de España y uno de los 15 más adinerados del planeta ha ampliado su cartera de activos en el sector de las energías renovables con su tercera alianza con Repsol , a través de la adquisición de una participación minoritaria en una cartera de plantas eólicas y fotovoltaicas .
Sólo en dividendos de Inditex, Ortega se ha embolsado algo más de 2.200 millones; una parte importante del preciado botín ha ido a parar una vez más al sector del ladrillo, para elevar el valor de su cartera hasta una cifra próxima a los 19.000 millones de euros.
Multiplicado por 13,4 Sin presencia activa en la gestión, Sandra Ortega mantiene la participación del 5% de Inditex que heredó de su madre, Rosalía Mera , primera esposa de Amancio Ortega y cofundadora de la compañía, que falleció hace una década.
Tras la salida a bolsa de Inditex, en 2001, Mera conservó este porcentaje, que fue valorado en la OPV en poco más de 455 millones de euros. Más de dos décadas después, esta cifra se ha multiplicado por 13,4.

title: While planning for 'new things' in 2024, recognize existing blessings
text: While planning for 'new things' in the New Year, recognize and appreciate your blessings The sundown of this year is just hours away. And already people have made plans, even special plans, for the coming “New Year.” Projected job changes, housing relocations, financial speculations and readjustments, dietary adjustments, family and marital considerations, legal speculations, and social and personal expectations. Added to those “new” projections are determined resolutions and promises to be unkept. The lifestyles will continue. The mindsets will be emboldened. Yet changes – new happenings, new opportunities – will often be repetitions of the past. Simply because God - the source of life - has been omitted in those prognostications for tomorrow. How is it that we can comfortably anticipate new and greater things for tomorrow when we have failed to recognize and appreciate the source of our yesterday's and today’s blessings? How is it that we can ignore the source and causes of yesterday’s failures and anticipate new and positive results for repeated faulty premises? How true that saying, “Two wrongs don’t make a right.” What makes us think that toasting the New Year, while still being inebriated for the indulgences of the past, will assure us a better tomorrow? How relevant and true is Paul’s introspective inquiry affirmed in Romans 7:24: “O wretched man that I am! Who shall deliver me from the body of this death?” When we recognize that many of our unachieved anticipations have their roots in the fact that the source of our being lies not in ourselves, but in the God who created us and all that makes up our realm of existence. How can there be tomorrow without the decretive and permissive will of the source of today? If you desire and expect a “new” thing for your tomorrow, then wisdom ought to direct you to seek God’s new thing for tomorrow. Realize it, believe it, or not, all of tomorrow and the tomorrows to come are in God’s hands. More: [Celebrate the birth of Jesus joyfully in worship, family gatherings and gift-giving](/story/lifestyle/faith/2023/12/24/celebrate-the-birth-of-jesus-christmas-eve-and-day-joyfully-in-worship/72004333007/) All of the political, economic, governmental, social, emotional, mental, personal, and spiritual elements and events that impact your life and mine are in God’s hands. No political decisions, actions, or shenanigans devised by any man, organization, or demonic effort can avoid nor offset the decretive and permissive will of God. And the eyes of God have never, nor will ever, miss any demonic or human effort to thwart his will and purpose for his people. That’s why God assures his faithful believers and followers that he has a new thing in store for us. Whatever tomorrow’s personal, local, national, and international situations and events may bring, every one of them is and will be appropriately adjusted to comply with God’s will. Looking at the plight of his chosen people Israel, God declared a “New Year’s Resolution” for those who have chosen to obey and follow him as the lord of their lives. That’s what God was conveying in Isaiah 43:12: “Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.” Whatever yesterday has been, whatever others have done, and still are trying to do; whatever you have failed to do, you are still my child. I have placed you and your present and future in my decretive and permission will. You belong to me. And I am not through with you yet. I will pave you a directed pathway through your “wilderness” situations. As you journey through the “desert” arenas of your life, I will quench your thirsty moments with divine resources. And you will know, you will experience, you will witness, you will comprehend that I will do something new in your life that only I can do for you Civilla Martin captured the essence of God’s New Year’s resolution in the lyrics of her hymn with these words: “Be not dismayed whate’er betide, God will take care of you. Beneath his wings of love abide, God will take care of you. No matter what may be the test, God will take care of you. Lean weary one upon his breast, God will take care of you. God will take care of You, Thru ev’ry day, o’er all the way He will take care of you, God will take care of You.” May your New Year be blessed by God’s New Year’s resolution for you. The Rev. Samuel W. Hale Jr. is the retired pastor of Zion Missionary Baptist Church.
